intro: Hierochloe alpina f. soperi, commonly known as the alpine hairgrass, is a flowering plant belonging to the grass family Poaceae. It is a perennial herb characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit and fine, hairy leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences bearing tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It thrives in alpine and subalpine environments, often found on rocky slopes and mountain meadows. Its botanical features make it well-adapted to harsh, high-altitude conditions.
